elements.title: Iowa Corn Song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a tradition is for singers of the Iowa Corn Song (audio featured) to raise their arms above their head when the words "tall corn" are sung during the chorus's last line?

elements.title: Jacopo Tissi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Italian Jacopo Tissi became one of the few foreign principal dancers in Bolshoi Ballet's history, only to leave two months later due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine?

elements.title: Holy Trinity Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Holy Trinity Church in Philadelphia, established in 1784, was the first national parish in the United States?

elements.title: Mordecai Strelisker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mordecai Strelisker published a Hebrew elegy on the death of Emperor Francis I of Austria?

elements.title: George Ward (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the spectacle lynching of George Ward drew the attendance of more than 1,000 people, including women and children?

elements.title: run Linux (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that you can now run Linux on an Apple-silicon Mac?

elements.title: Emily Pogorelc (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American soprano Emily Pogorelc went from winning the 2018 "Most Promising Talent" prize at Glyndebourne to appearing as Mozart's Cherubino at the Munich Opera Festival?

elements.title: The Evolution of Atheism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in his 2015 book The Evolution of Atheism, atheist Stephen LeDrew criticises the New Atheism movement?
